questions.question: How do customers benefit from Amazon's massive economies of scale?

options.text: Periodic price reductions as the result of Amazon's operational efficiencies
New Amazon EC2 instance types providing the latest hardware
The ability to scale up and down when needed
Increased reliability in the underlying hardware of Amazon EC2 instances

questions.explanation: Amazon’s massive economies of scale allow AWS to reduce costs as it grows, and these savings are passed on to customers through regular price reductions.

questions.question: Which AWS services can be used to gather information about AWS account activity? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: AWS CloudTrail records all API activity in an AWS account, while Amazon CloudWatch collects and monitors metrics and logs, allowing visibility into account activity.

questions.question: Which of the following common IT tasks can AWS cover to free up company IT resources? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: AWS managed services such as RDS automatically handle tasks like patching database software and backing up databases, freeing up IT resources.

questions.question: In which scenario should Amazon EC2 Spot Instances be used?

options.text: A company wants to move its main website to AWS from an on-premises web server.
A company has a number of application services whose Service Level Agreement (SLA) requires 99.999% uptime.
A company's heavily used legacy database is currently running on-premises.
A company has a number of infrequent, interruptible jobs that are currently using On-Demand Instances.

questions.explanation: Spot Instances are ideal for workloads that can be interrupted, such as batch jobs or background processing, because they provide very low cost unused capacity.

questions.question: Which AWS feature should a customer leverage to achieve high availability of an application?
questions.explanation: Availability Zones allow applications to run across physically separate data centers, providing high availability and fault tolerance.

questions.question: Which is the minimum AWS Support plan that includes Infrastructure Event Management without additional costs?
questions.explanation: The Business Support plan is the minimum plan that includes Infrastructure Event Management without additional charges.

questions.question: Which AWS service can serve a static website?
questions.explanation: Amazon S3 can host static websites by serving HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and image files directly from storage without requiring a web server.

questions.question: How does AWS shorten the time to provision IT resources?

options.text: It supplies an online IT ticketing platform for resource requests.
It supports automatic code validation services.
It provides the ability to programmatically provision existing resources.
It automates the resource request process from a company's IT vendor list.

questions.explanation: AWS allows customers to programmatically provision resources through APIs, CLI, and infrastructure as code tools, reducing provisioning time from weeks to minutes.

questions.question: What can AWS edge locations be used for? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Reducing traffic on the server by caching responses
Sending notification messages to end users

questions.explanation: Edge locations deliver content closer to users and cache responses to reduce load on origin servers, improving performance and reducing traffic.

questions.question: Which of the following can limit Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket access to specific users?

options.text: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies

questions.explanation: IAM policies define which users or roles can access an S3 bucket and what actions they can perform.

questions.question: A solution that is able to support growth in users, traffic, or data size with no drop in performance aligns with which cloud architecture principle?
questions.explanation: Elasticity means that a system can automatically grow or shrink to handle increases in users, traffic, or data without performance degradation.

questions.question: Which of the following tasks is the responsibility of AWS?

options.text: Configuring AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles

questions.explanation: AWS is responsible for securing the EC2 hypervisor and underlying infrastructure, while customers manage what runs on top of it.

questions.question: One benefit of On-Demand Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) pricing is:

options.text: the ability to bid for a lower hourly cost.
paying a daily rate regardless of time used.
pre-paying for instances and paying a lower hourly rate.

questions.explanation: On-Demand pricing charges only for the compute time actually used, with no long-term commitment.

questions.question:
An administrator needs to rapidly deploy a popular IT solution and start using it immediately.
Where can the administrator find assistance?
questions.explanation: AWS Quick Starts provide pre-built reference deployments that allow customers to rapidly deploy popular IT solutions following AWS best practices.

questions.question: Which of the following services is in the category of AWS serverless platform?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service where AWS manages the servers and scaling, allowing customers to run code without provisioning infrastructure.

questions.question: Which services are parts of the AWS serverless platform?

options.text: Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon Athena
Amazon Kinesis, Amazon SQS, Amazon EMR
AWS Step Functions, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon SNS
Amazon Athena, Amazon Cognito, Amazon EC2

questions.explanation: Services like AWS Step Functions, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon SNS are fully managed and part of AWS’s serverless platform.

questions.question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following is a shared control between a customer and AWS?
questions.explanation: Patch management is a shared responsibility because AWS patches the infrastructure, while customers patch the operating systems and applications they run.

questions.question: What can AWS edge locations be used for? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Reducing traffic on the server by caching responses
Sending notification messages to end users

questions.explanation: Edge locations are used by CloudFront to deliver content closer to users and cache responses to reduce traffic to the origin.

questions.question: What technology enables compute capacity to adjust as loads change?
questions.explanation: Auto Scaling automatically adjusts compute capacity up or down based on demand.

questions.question: Which AWS services are defined as global instead of regional? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: Amazon Route 53 and Amazon CloudFront are global services that operate across all AWS Regions.

questions.question: Which AWS service would you use to obtain compliance reports and certificates?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports, certifications, and agreements.

questions.question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following tasks are the responsibility of the AWS customer? (Select TWO.)

options.text: Ensuring that application data is encrypted at rest
Ensuring that AWS NTP servers are set to the correct time
Ensuring that users have received security training in the use of AWS services
Ensuring that access to data centers is restricted
Ensuring that hardware is disposed of properly

questions.explanation: Customers are responsible for encrypting their data and ensuring that users are trained to use AWS services securely.

questions.question: Which AWS service can be used to manually launch instances based on resource requirements?
questions.explanation: Amazon EC2 allows customers to manually launch and manage compute instances based on their resource requirements.

questions.question:
A company is migrating an application that is running non-interruptible workloads for a three-year time frame.
Which pricing construct would provide the MOST cost-effective solution?
questions.explanation: Reserved Instances offer the lowest cost for long-term, predictable, non-interruptible workloads over a one- or three-year term.

questions.question: The financial benefits of using AWS are: (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: AWS reduces total cost of ownership and operational expenses by eliminating the need to purchase and maintain physical infrastructure.

questions.question: Which of the following is entirely the responsibility of AWS, according to the AWS shared responsibility model?

options.text: Patching of the guest operating system
Development of an IAM password policy

questions.explanation: AWS is fully responsible for physical and environmental security of data centers.

questions.question: Which AWS service allows companies to connect an Amazon VPC to an on-premises data center? (Select TWO)
questions.explanation: AWS VPN and AWS Direct Connect both provide secure connectivity between an on-premises data center and an Amazon VPC.

questions.question:
A company wants to reduce the physical compute footprint that developers use to run code.
Which service would meet that need by enabling serverless architectures?
questions.explanation: AWS Lambda enables serverless architectures by allowing developers to run code without managing servers.

questions.question: Which AWS service provides alerts when an AWS event may impact a company's AWS resources?
questions.explanation: The AWS Personal Health Dashboard provides alerts and information about AWS events that could affect a specific customer’s resources.

questions.question: Which of the following are categories of AWS Trusted Advisor? (Select TWO.)
questions.explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor categories include Fault Tolerance and Performance, among others.

questions.question: Which of the following services falls under the responsibility of the customer to maintain operating system configuration, security patching, and networking?    - A. Amazon RDS
questions.explanation: With Amazon EC2, customers are responsible for operating system configuration, security patching, and networking.

questions.question:
A company will be moving from an on-premises data center to the AWS Cloud.
What would be one financial difference after the move?

options.text: Moving from variable operational expense (opex) to upfront capital expense (capex).
Moving from upfront capital expense (capex) to variable capital expense (capex).
Moving from upfront capital expense (capex) to variable operational expense (opex).
Elimination of upfront capital expense (capex) and elimination of variable operational expense (opex)

questions.explanation: Moving to AWS shifts spending from upfront capital expenses to variable operational expenses based on usage.

questions.question: How should a customer forecast the future costs for running a new web application?
questions.explanation: The AWS Simple Monthly Calculator helps estimate and forecast the costs of running workloads on AWS.

questions.question: Which is the MINIMUM AWS Support plan that provides technical support through phone calls?
questions.explanation: The Business Support plan is the minimum support tier that includes phone access to AWS technical support.

questions.question: According to the AWS shared responsibility model, what is the sole responsibility of AWS?
questions.explanation: AWS is solely responsible for managing edge locations and the global infrastructure.

questions.question: Which AWS IAM feature is used to associate a set of permissions with multiple users?
questions.explanation: IAM Groups allow administrators to assign a set of permissions to multiple users at once.

questions.question: Which of the following are benefits of the AWS Cloud? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: Elasticity and agility allow AWS customers to scale resources quickly and adapt to changing business needs.

questions.question: Which of the following can a customer use to enable single sign-on (SSO) to the AWS Console?
questions.explanation: AWS Directory Service enables integration with corporate directories to provide single sign-on to the AWS Management Console.

questions.question: What are the multiple, isolated locations within an AWS Region that are connected by low-latency networks called?
questions.explanation: Availability Zones are multiple, isolated locations within a Region that are connected by low-latency networks.

questions.question: Which of the following benefits does the AWS Compliance program provide to AWS customers? (Choose two.)

options.text: It verifies that hosted workloads are automatically compliant with the controls of supported compliance frameworks.
AWS is responsible for the maintenance of common compliance framework documentation.
It assures customers that AWS is maintaining physical security and data protection.
It ensures the use of compliance frameworks that are being used by other cloud providers.
It will adopt new compliance frameworks as they become relevant to customer workloads.

questions.explanation: The AWS Compliance Program ensures AWS maintains compliance documentation and frameworks for customer use.

questions.question: Which of the following services provides on-demand access to AWS compliance reports?
questions.explanation: AWS Artifact provides customers with on-demand access to AWS compliance and audit reports.

questions.question: As part of the AWS shared responsibility model, which of the following operational controls do users fully inherit from AWS?
questions.explanation: Customers fully inherit user and access management controls from AWS as part of the shared responsibility model.

questions.question: When comparing AWS Cloud with on-premises Total Cost of Ownership, which expenses must be considered? (Choose two.)
questions.explanation: When comparing TCO, storage hardware and physical servers must be included as major infrastructure costs.

questions.question: Under the shared responsibility model, which of the following tasks are the responsibility of the customer? (Choose two.)

options.text: Maintaining the underlying Amazon EC2 hardware.
Managing the VPC network access control lists.
Encrypting data in transit and at rest.
Deploying hardware in different Availability Zones.

questions.explanation: Customers manage their own network access control lists and must encrypt their data in transit and at rest.

questions.question: Which scenarios represent the concept of elasticity on AWS? (Choose two.)

options.text: Scaling the number of Amazon EC2 instances based on traffic.
Resizing Amazon RDS instances as business needs change.
Automatically directing traffic to less-utilized Amazon EC2 instances.
Using AWS compliance documents to accelerate the compliance process.
Having the ability to create and govern environments using code.

questions.explanation: Elasticity is shown by scaling EC2 instances and resizing RDS databases based on changing demand.

questions.question: When is it beneficial for a company to use a Spot Instance?

options.text: When there is flexibility in when an application needs to run.
When an instance should not be stopped.

questions.explanation: Spot Instances are ideal when workloads are flexible and can tolerate interruptions.

questions.question: A company is considering moving its on-premises data center to AWS. What factors should be included in doing a Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) analysis? (Choose two.)

options.text: Power consumption of the data center
Labor costs to replace old servers

questions.explanation: Power consumption and labor costs for maintaining hardware are key factors in a TCO analysis.

questions.question: How does AWS charge for AWS Lambda?

options.text: Users bid on the maximum price they are willing to pay per hour.
Users choose a 1-, 3- or 5-year upfront payment term.
Users pay for the required permanent storage on a file system or in a database.
Users pay based on the number of requests and consumed compute resources.

questions.explanation: AWS Lambda charges based on the number of requests and the amount of compute time consumed.

questions.question: What function do security groups serve related Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance security?

options.text: Act as a virtual firewall for the Amazon EC2 instance.
Secure AWS user accounts with AWS identity and Access Management (IAM) policies.
Provide DDoS protection with AWS Shield.
Use Amazon CloudFront to protect the Amazon EC2 instance.

questions.explanation: Security groups act as virtual firewalls that control inbound and outbound traffic for EC2 instances.

questions.question: Which disaster recovery scenario offers the lowest probability of down time?
questions.explanation: Multi-site active-active disaster recovery runs systems in multiple locations simultaneously, minimizing downtime.
